structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS
COUNTY GOVERNMENT (FISCAL COURTS AND COUNTY COMMISSIONERS)

law.catch_line: Rights, powers, privileges, immunities, and responsibilities of unified local government -- Continuance of county and highest participating class of city laws -- Enactment and enforcement of ordinances.

text.section:
A unified local government may exercise the constitutional and statutory rights, powers, privileges, immunities, and responsibilities of counties and of cities of the highest class within the unified local government:
In effect on the date the unified local government becomes effective;
Which may subsequently be authorized for or imposed upon counties and cities of that class; and
Which may be authorized for or imposed upon unified local governments.
A unified local government shall be accorded the same sovereign immunity granted counties, their agencies, officers, and employees.
All ordinances of a unified local government shall be enacted and enforced pursuant to KRS 83A.060 and 83A.065.

law.history: Created 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 246, sec. 12, effective July 12, 2006.
